intro: Copiapoa cinerea nothosubsp. scopa, commonly known as the Scopa Copiapoa, is a hybrid cactus native to the Atacama Desert in Chile. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems that are typically covered in a white, powdery coating. The plant produces yellow flowers during the cooler months, usually in spring. It is a slow-growing species that requires well-draining soil and minimal water. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated by enthusiasts for its ornamental value.
